newsitem.title: CHINA: China confirms first ship sails directly to Taiwan.
newsitem.headline: China confirms first ship sails directly to Taiwan.

text.p: Chinese officials confirmed that the first mainland ship to sail directly for Taiwan in more than four decades left the southern port of Xiamen at 4.00 a.m. (2000 GMT Friday) on Saturday, port officials said.
The Sheng Da was expected to arrive late on Saturday in the southern Taiwan port of Kaohsiung, one port official said.
Chinese officials had given permission for 10 sailings each week from Xiamen and a reciprocal 10 a week were expected from Kaohsiung, the port official said.
He said he expected the first Taiwan vessel to set sail for China under the system that effectively ends a 40 year ban by Taipei on direct shipping links to leave on April 24.
The Sheng Da was carrying containers, but details of its cargo were not available, the official said. The voyage was expected to take about 18 hours, he said.

Taiwan's southern port of Kaohsiung said on Saturday it had received a formal entry notice from the Sheng Da, one of the five mainland China sea-freight firms that Taiwan recently approved to sail directly into Kaohsiung from China.
